poem:
Title: In Service of Kruger's Noisy Palette

Shattering glass voice,
a metronome's tick enraged -
the cacophony within.
Echoes bounce and clamor,
Kruger's thoughts erupt, 
like Big Ben's grand declaration.
Sorry - Ker-ching! Ker-ching!
A switchback of sound,
reworking silence into 
loud discourse,
Thinking of her,
no, me -
no, you,
In the Serpentine's silent scream.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘As subtle as a brick in the face’: Barbara Kruger’s cacophonous Trumpspeak premonitions Hello? Hello? Sorry. Ker-ching! Ker-ching! Sorry again. A metronome beat is becoming a machine-gun burst of hammering and clanging, interspersed with Big Ben chimes and distant echoes from other rooms. This is Barbara Kruger’s Thinking of You. I Mean Me. I Mean You, at the Serpentine. The title is anything but an equivocation. This is a show filled with switchbacks, reversals, reworkings". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘As subtle as a brick in the face’: Barbara Kruger’s cacophonous Trumpspeak premonitions Hello? Hello? Sorry. Ker-ching! Ker-ching! Sorry again. I Mean You, at the Serpentine. The title is anything but an equivocation. This is a show filled with switchbacks, reversals, reworkings
